description: CEFR B2 핵심 문법 - 복합 시제, 가정법 과거완료, 분사구문

grammarPoints.name: past_perfect
grammarPoints.explanation: Use past perfect for an action that happened before another past action.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 과거의 다른 행동보다 먼저 일어난 행동을 표현할 때 과거완료를 사용해요.

examples.en: When I arrived, she had already left.
examples.ko: 내가 도착했을 때 그녀는 이미 떠났었어요.

examples.en: I had never seen that before.
Had you finished before the deadline?
They realized they had made a mistake.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: '~했었다'에 해당해요. 과거보다 더 이전의 과거를 표현해요.

commonErrors.wrong: When I arrived, she already left.
commonErrors.correct: When I arrived, she had already left.

grammarPoints.name: third_conditional
grammarPoints.explanation: Use third conditional for unreal situations in the past.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 과거에 실제로 일어나지 않은 상황을 가정할 때 사용해요.

forms.structure: If + past perfect, would have + past participle

examples.en: If I had known, I would have helped.
She would have passed if she had studied.
If they had left earlier, they wouldn't have missed the train.
examples.ko: 일찍 떠났더라면 기차를 놓치지 않았을 거예요.

examples.en: What would you have done if you had won?

grammarPoints.koreanTip: '~했더라면 ~했을 텐데'에 해당해요. 과거 사실과 반대되는 가정이에요.

grammarPoints.name: wish_clauses
grammarPoints.explanation: Use wish to express regrets and desires for different situations.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 후회나 다른 상황에 대한 바람을 표현할 때 wish를 사용해요.

forms.future: I wish + would + verb (wishes for change)

examples.en: I wish I had more time.
I wish I had studied harder.
I wish you would stop talking.
She wishes she were taller.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: 현재 상황에 대한 아쉬움은 과거형, 과거에 대한 후회는 과거완료형을 써요.

commonErrors.wrong: I wish I have more time.
commonErrors.correct: I wish I had more time.

grammarPoints.name: participle_clauses
grammarPoints.explanation: Use participle clauses to combine sentences and add information.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 문장을 결합하고 정보를 추가할 때 분사구문을 사용해요.

examples.en: Walking home, I saw an accident.
Written in 1920, the book is still relevant.
Having finished work, I went home.
Knowing the answer, she raised her hand.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: 주어가 같을 때 사용해요. ~하면서, ~해서, ~한 채로 등의 의미예요.

commonErrors.correct: Walking home, I got caught in the rain.

commonErrors.wrong: Seeing the movie, it was boring.
commonErrors.correct: Seeing the movie, I was bored.

grammarPoints.name: modals_deduction
grammarPoints.explanation: Use modals for making deductions about present and past.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 현재와 과거에 대한 추측을 할 때 조동사를 사용해요.

forms.past_possible: might have / could have + past participle

examples.en: She must be tired.
He can't be at home.
They must have forgotten.
It might have been a mistake.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: must는 강한 추측(~임에 틀림없다), can't는 불가능(~일 리 없다), might는 가능성(~일 수도).

grammarPoints.name: causative
grammarPoints.explanation: Use causatives when someone else does something for you.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 다른 사람이 나를 위해 무언가를 할 때 사역 구문을 사용해요.

forms.have: have + object + past participle (arrange for service)
forms.get: get + object + past participle (similar to have)

examples.en: I had my car repaired.
She got her hair cut.
The teacher made us repeat.
My parents let me go out.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: have/get something done은 '~를 해 받다', make는 '~하게 하다', let은 '~하게 허락하다'.

commonErrors.wrong: She made me to do it.

grammarPoints.name: inversion
grammarPoints.explanation: Use inversion for emphasis or in formal contexts.

forms.conditional: Had I known... / Were I to...

examples.en: Never have I seen such a thing.
Rarely do we get such opportunities.
Had I known, I would have helped.
Were she to ask, I would agree.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: 부정어가 문두에 오면 주어와 동사가 도치돼요. 격식체에서 많이 사용해요.

grammarPoints.name: mixed_conditionals
grammarPoints.explanation: Use mixed conditionals when time in if-clause differs from main clause.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: if절의 시점과 주절의 시점이 다를 때 혼합 조건문을 사용해요.

forms.past_present: If + past perfect, would + verb (past condition, present result)
forms.present_past: If + past simple, would have + past participle

examples.en: If I had studied medicine, I would be a doctor now.
If she were more careful, she wouldn't have made that mistake.
examples.ko: 그녀가 더 조심했더라면 그 실수를 안 했을 텐데.

examples.en: If I hadn't met her, my life would be different.
examples.ko: 그녀를 만나지 않았더라면 내 인생이 달랐을 거예요.

examples.en: If he were smarter, he would have passed.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: 과거 원인 → 현재 결과, 또는 현재 조건 → 과거 결과를 표현해요.

commonErrors.wrong: If I studied, I would be doctor.
commonErrors.correct: If I had studied, I would be a doctor.

commonErrors.wrong: If I were you, I would helped.
commonErrors.correct: If I were you, I would have helped.

grammarPoints.name: cleft_sentences
grammarPoints.explanation: Use cleft sentences to emphasize specific information.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 특정 정보를 강조할 때 분열문을 사용해요.

examples.en: It was John who called you.
What I need is more time.
examples.ko: 내가 필요한 건 더 많은 시간이에요.

examples.en: It's the price that bothers me.
examples.ko: 나를 신경 쓰이게 하는 건 가격이에요.

examples.en: What she said was surprising.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: '바로 ~가 ~한 것이다'로 해석해요. 강조하고 싶은 부분이 앞에 와요.

grammarPoints.name: subjunctive
grammarPoints.explanation: Use subjunctive after verbs of suggestion, demand, recommendation.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 제안, 요구, 권고 동사 뒤에 가정법 현재(동사원형)를 사용해요.

examples.en: I suggest that he leave now.
She recommended that we be careful.
They demanded that he resign.
It's important that she attend.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: that절에서 주어와 상관없이 동사원형을 써요. 매우 격식체 표현이에요.

commonErrors.wrong: She insisted that he was there.
commonErrors.correct: She insisted that he be there.
